common_errors.cause: File is not a valid object file or binary format objdump can't handle
common_errors.solution: Check file type with: file <filename>. objdump supports ELF, Mach-O, PE/COFF, etc.
Rebuild without stripping for debugging. Use -D (--dynamic) to see dynamic symbols.
Verify filename and path. Use tab completion to avoid typos.

common_errors.cause: Section exists but contains no data (may be debugging info only)
common_errors.solution: Use -h to list all sections. Check -j <section> specifies valid data section.

common_errors.cause: Binary is for different architecture than objdump was built for
common_errors.solution: Use cross-arch objdump (e.g., aarch64-linux-gnu-objdump) or specify -m <arch>

common_errors.cause: Cannot read the file due to permissions
common_errors.solution: Check file permissions. Use sudo if necessary for system binaries.
Check objdump --help for valid options. Common: -d (disassemble), -h (headers), -t (symbols)

common_errors.cause: Relocation type objdump doesn't understand (rare, exotic arch)
common_errors.solution: Try newer version of binutils. May need custom build for exotic targets.

common_errors.cause: Requesting DWARF debug info but binary has none
common_errors.solution: Rebuild with -g flag. Debug info may be in separate .debug file.
Rebuild the binary. Check disk for errors. Verify download if from network.
